snippet: Mr. Sloss, making his solo New York debut at SoHo Playhouse, grew tired of TV-safe stand-up. Now he does comedy about atheism and has audiences walking out.
abstract: Scottish comedian Daniel Sloss will begin five-night stint at SoHo Playhouse, showcasing his unique bombastic style; young comic, who launched his career on British television with cheeky fare, hopes his switch to dark, more controversial brand of humor will be embraced by American audiences.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Sloss, making his solo New York debut at SoHo Playhouse, grew tired of TV-safe stand-up. Now he does comedy about atheism and has audiences walking out.

headline.main: Daniel Sloss Brings Young, Scottish and Blustery to New York
headline.print_headline: Young, Scottish and Blustery,  a Stand-Up Goes to the Dark Side
